result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen E. Koehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work/fulltime school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours of community service.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amount.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.
3 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment or combination.   No objection to EMP.
Courts costs paid in full by cash bond.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glen E. Koehler

Case Called: 9:16 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Rick Cveykus.
COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 2 (Possess w/Intent-THC (>2500-10,000g)-Conspiracy to Commit))>> 7 Months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination. No objection to EMP. Court finds 79 Days Credit.
Adjourned: 9:18 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 10, 2017 at 09:15 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 11:04 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Rick Cveykus;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Possess w/Intent-THC (>2500-10,000g)-Conspiracy to Commit))>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 3 days credit.

Adjourned: 11:12 am
Plea hearing on July 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 25, 2016 at 10:15 am.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Rick Cveykus.
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY.
Dates set: Pretrial Conference 2/9/2016 @ 3:00 am
Bond Continued.

Preliminary Hearing at 01-07-2016 09:10 am.

records.addlTxt: $10,000.00 SIGNATURE W/ FIRST $2,500.00 CASH. Absolute sobriety from controlled substances. No controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for drugs-day report.   No contact with F.A., M.G., & K.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
